title: Installation issue: glib %gcc@8.3.0 on MacOS Mojave
body:
<!-- Thanks for taking the time to report this build failure. To proceed with the report please:

1. Title the issue "Installation issue: <name-of-the-package>".
2. Provide the information required below.

We encourage you to try, as much as possible, to reduce your problem to the minimal example that still reproduces the issue. That would help us a lot in fixing it quickly and effectively! -->

1. I have no clue why this install would be referencing header files under the Xcode app:
```console
/Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer/Platforms/MacOSX.platform/Developer/SDKs/MacOSX.sdk/System/Library/Frameworks/Security.framework/Headers/Authorization.h:193:7: error: variably modified 'bytes' at file scope
  char bytes[kAuthorizationExternalFormLength];
       ^~~~~
```
2. I'm not understanding the compiler error. The make error output doesn't seem to point back to any particular glib source file.


### Steps to reproduce the issue

<!-- Fill in the exact spec you are trying to build and the relevant part of the error message -->
Starting from a clean slate macOS Mojave (10.14.6) with latest XCode 11.3.

```console
$ git clone https://github.com/spack/spack.git
$ git checkout releases/v0.14
$ source share/spack/setup-env.sh
$ spack install gcc@8.3.0  #Success, no errors reported
$ spack compiler add $(spack location -i gcc@8.3.0)
$ spack install glib %gcc@8.3.0
...
```


### Information on your system

Regarding the issue template prompt, "Please include the output of `spack debug report` ", I receive an error that `report` is not a valid subcommand.  Am I misunderstanding the request?

This is a Apple MacBook Pro 2019 - Skylake processor
MacOS Mojave 10.14.6
XCode 11.3.1 is installed which provides a clang 11.0 install that I'm trying **not** to use due to several other errors that looked more complicated.
Python is installed by Anaconda.
```
$ which python
//anaconda3/bin/python
$ python --version
Python 3.7.3
```


<!-- If you have any relevant configuration detail (custom `packages.yaml` or `modules.yaml`, etc.) you can add that here as well. -->

### Additional information

<!-- Please upload the following files. They should be present in the stage directory of the failing build. Also upload any config.log or similar file if one exists. -->
* [spack-build-out.txt](https://github.com/spack/spack/files/4478498/spack-build-out.txt)
* [spack-build-env.txt](https://github.com/spack/spack/files/4478463/env.txt)

<!-- Some packages have maintainers who have volunteered to debug build failures. Run `spack maintainers <name-of-the-package>` and @mention them here if they exist. -->

### General information

<!-- These boxes can be checked by replacing [ ] with [x] or by clicking them after submitting the issue. -->
- [x] I have run `spack debug report` [yes](https://github.com/spack/spack/files/4478392/spack-db.releases-v0.14.e2b1737a4.2020-04-14-171733.tar.gz) and reported the version of Spack/Python/Platform
- [x] I have run `spack maintainers <name-of-the-package>` and @mentioned any maintainers
    - No maintainers listed.
- [x] I have uploaded the [build log](https://github.com/spack/spack/files/4478498/spack-build-out.txt) and [environment files](https://github.com/spack/spack/files/4478463/env.txt)
     - uploaded shell environment.
     - `$ spack env list` `==> No environments`
- [x] I have searched the issues of this repo and believe this is not a duplicate
